page.title: 13Roman Catholic Church
page.content: St. Teresa Roman Catholic Church was designed by an Italian architect called Mr. Renvolueri who lived in Glan Conwy and was opened in 1934. Built of stone it has the unusual shape of 5 domes - one main dome and 4 domes leading off it to form a cross. It has many interesting features and well worth a visit. The Christening font is in the shape of a globe. Designer of internal decor at present is architect Mr. Bill Davies. Parish priest is Mansignor Shikan who is of Dutch Nationality and has served the Parish since 1950. His house is joined to the Church and he is always available to his parishioners. Services: Sunday morning 9.30 am Mass at St. Teresa evey Monday, Wednesday, Friday and Saturday.
